SENT.plain: Author presents a ten-year experience in cerebral hemorrhages in infancy and childhood

The importance of congenital vascular malformations is specially remarked and it is also lined out the importance of cerebral hemorrhages due to head injuries, inflammatory process, hemopathies and brain tumors
Neuroradiological procedures are briefly described and the utility of the association computed tomography/cerebral angiography is pointed out
It is too presented a neuroradiological classification of cerebrovascular malformations
